Auto Deep Forest Construction.

DEFAULT_EXECUTOR_CLS

bosk.auto.deep_forest.DEFAULT_MAKE_METRICS()#
bosk.auto.deep_forest.DEFAULT_EXECUTOR_CLS#
class bosk.auto.deep_forest.BaseAutoDeepForestConstructor(executor_cls, max_iter=10, cv=5, make_metrics=None, growing_strategy=None, block_classes=None, random_state=None)#

Bases: abc.ABC

Base Auto Deep Forest Construction Algorithm.

Sequentially constructs a pipeline using given data set. Construction is splitted into steps, where each step is subdivided into iterations:

  • At different steps the algorithm makes principally different blocks;

  • At different iterations the algorithm generates layers of the same structure.

Parameters:

  • executor_cls (Type[bosk.executor.base.BaseExecutor]) – Executor class (see bosk.executor).

  • max_iter (int) – Maximum number of iterations.

  • cv (Optional[int]) – Number of cross-validation folds. If None the cross-validation is not performed.

  • make_metrics (Optional[Callable[[], bosk.auto.metrics.MetricsEvaluator]]) – Function that makes metrics evaluator.

  • growing_strategy (Optional[bosk.auto.growing_strategies.GrowingStrategy]) – Growing strategy.

  • block_classes (Optional[Tuple[Type[bosk.block.base.BaseBlock], Ellipsis]]) – List of block classes used in layers.

  • random_state (Optional[int]) – Random state.

abstract property n_steps: Optional[int]#

Number of implemented steps.

The steps with number < n_steps will be passed to make_step_layer.

Return type:

Optional[int]

abstract make_step_layer(step, iteration, X, y, validator, rng)#

Make the current step layer.

Parameters:

  • step (int) – Current step number.

  • iteration (int) – Current iteration number.

  • X (numpy.ndarray) – Input features data.

  • y (numpy.ndarray) – Target data.

  • validator (bosk.auto.validation.BasePipelineModelValidator) – Pipeline model validator.

  • rng (numpy.random.Generator) – Random number generator.

Return type:

Optional[bosk.auto.layers.Layer]

construct(X_, y_)#

Construct the pipeline given training data.

Parameters:

  • X_ (numpy.ndarray) – Input features data.

  • y_ (numpy.ndarray) – Target data.

Return type:

bosk.pipeline.base.BasePipeline

bosk.auto.deep_forest._make_base_df_blocks(params, layer_width, block_classes=None)#

Make base Deep Forest Blocks for one layer.

Parameters:

  • params (dict) – One Forest parameters (n_estimators, max_depth, etc.).

  • layer_width (int) – Number of blocks of one type in the layer.

  • block_classes (Optional[Tuple[Type[bosk.block.base.BaseBlock], Ellipsis]]) –

Returns:

List of layer blocks.

Return type:

List[bosk.block.base.BaseBlock]

class bosk.auto.deep_forest.ClassicalDeepForestConstructor(executor_cls, rf_params=None, layer_width=2, max_iter=10, cv=5, make_metrics=None, growing_strategy=None, block_classes=None, random_state=None)#

Bases: BaseAutoDeepForestConstructor

Classical Deep Forest iteratively builds layers consisting of different Random Forests and Extremely Randomized Trees Classifiers.

Parameters:

  • executor_cls (Type[bosk.executor.base.BaseExecutor]) – Executor class (see bosk.executor).

  • rf_params (Optional[dict]) – Parameters of tree ensembles (Random Forests, Extra Trees).

  • layer_width (int) – Number of blocks of each type in a layer.

  • max_iter (int) – Maximum number of iterations.

  • cv (Optional[int]) – Number of cross-validation folds. If None the cross-validation is not performed.

  • make_metrics (Optional[Callable[[], bosk.auto.metrics.MetricsEvaluator]]) – Function that makes metrics evaluator.

  • growing_strategy (Optional[bosk.auto.growing_strategies.GrowingStrategy]) – Growing strategy.

  • block_classes (Optional[Tuple[Type[bosk.block.base.BaseBlock], Ellipsis]]) – List of block classes used in layers.

  • random_state (Optional[int]) – Random state.

rf_params#

Parameters of tree ensembles (Random Forests, Extra Trees).

LAYER_CLS#
n_steps = 1#

Number of steps. The Classical Deep Forest has just one step.

make_step_layer(step, iteration, X, y, validator, rng)#

Make the current step layer.

Parameters:

  • step (int) – Current step number.

  • iteration (int) – Current iteration number.

  • X (numpy.ndarray) – Input features data.

  • y (numpy.ndarray) – Target data.

  • validator (bosk.auto.validation.BasePipelineModelValidator) – Pipeline model validator.

  • rng (numpy.random.Generator) – Random number generator.

class bosk.auto.deep_forest.HyperparamSearchDeepForestConstructor(executor_cls, rf_param_grid=None, layer_width=2, n_steps=3, max_iter=10, cv=5, make_metrics=None, growing_strategy=None, block_classes=None, random_state=None)#

Bases: BaseAutoDeepForestConstructor

Classical Deep Forest that estimates the best parameters at each step.

Parameters:

  • executor_cls (Type[bosk.executor.base.BaseExecutor]) – Executor class (see bosk.executor).

  • rf_params – Parameters of tree ensembles (Random Forests, Extra Trees).

  • layer_width (int) – Number of blocks of each type in a layer.

  • n_steps (int) – Number of steps.

  • max_iter (int) – Maximum number of iterations.

  • cv (Optional[int]) – Number of cross-validation folds. If None the cross-validation is not performed.

  • make_metrics (Optional[Callable[[], bosk.auto.metrics.MetricsEvaluator]]) – Function that makes metrics evaluator.

rf_param_grid#

Parameters grid for the tree ensembles (Random Forests, Extra Trees).

n_steps#

Number of steps. At each step the best parameters are estimated.

class bosk.auto.deep_forest.MGSDeepForestConstructor(executor_cls, input_shape, rf_params=None, conv_params=None, layer_width=2, max_iter=10, cv=5, make_metrics=None, growing_strategy=None, block_classes=None, random_state=None)#

Bases: BaseAutoDeepForestConstructor

Classical Multi-Grained Scanning Deep Forest.

It consists of convolutional layers which reduce spatial dimensions (step 1), and classical stacking-based layers (step 2).

Parameters:

  • executor_cls (Type[bosk.executor.base.BaseExecutor]) – Executor class (see bosk.executor).

  • input_shape (Tuple[int]) – Input shape (spatial dimensions).

  • rf_params (Optional[dict]) – Parameters of tree ensembles (Random Forests, Extra Trees).

  • conv_params (Optional[dict]) – Parameters of MGS layers.

  • layer_width (int) – Number of blocks of each type in a layer.

  • max_iter (int) – Maximum number of iterations.

  • cv (Optional[int]) – Number of cross-validation folds. If None the cross-validation is not performed.

  • make_metrics (Optional[Callable[[], bosk.auto.metrics.MetricsEvaluator]]) – Function that makes metrics evaluator.

  • growing_strategy (Optional[bosk.auto.growing_strategies.GrowingStrategy]) – Growing strategy.

  • block_classes (Optional[Tuple[Type[bosk.block.base.BaseBlock], Ellipsis]]) – List of block classes used in layers.

  • random_state (Optional[int]) – Random state.

rf_params#

Parameters of tree ensembles (Random Forests, Extra Trees).

STACKING_LAYER_CLS#
MGS_LAYER_CLS#
n_steps = 2#

Number of steps. The Classical Deep Forest has two steps.

make_step_layer(step, iteration, X, y, validator, rng)#

Make the current step layer.

Parameters:

  • step (int) – Current step number.

  • iteration (int) – Current iteration number.

  • X (numpy.ndarray) – Input features data.

  • y (numpy.ndarray) – Target data.

  • validator (bosk.auto.validation.BasePipelineModelValidator) – Pipeline model validator.

  • rng (numpy.random.Generator) – Random number generator.
